reviewText: This is absolutely excellent!!! Wonderful in all regards. A must see for all ages!! IT IS THE GREATEST STORY EVER TOLD!
summary: Wonderful! Full of goodness and truth!
Title: Jesus Film

reviewText: saw this years ago when it was first out and of all the many movies i've seen made about Jesus, this is by far the most accurate in what Jesus says and how events happened. so happy to see it's out there for purchase after remembering it recently. the only thing that isn't accurate as it is in every Jesus movie is how Jesus dresses. to my surprise, i learned visiting Israel ( land of all lands) that Jesus dressed as a rabbi fully- not in a robe as always depicted. would like to see a Jesus movie made depicting the fact that He was a Jew and a rabbi- that was be the ultimate.
summary: the Jesus movie of all time
Title: Jesus Film

reviewText: If they had simply remastered the film, and made it widescreen, I would have been very pleased with the New 35th Anniversary Edition of The Jesus Film. But they chose to do things to this new edition that I feel really messed things up.* I purchased this DVD at a local store, and not on Amazon dot com.To begin with, this 35th Edition has a New Narrator whose voice is often timesway too loud, and is also very annoying at times.They should have kept the Original Narrator who was on the Original Release of The Jesus Film. His voice was always at a comfortable volume, and easy to listen to.Plus this 35th Edition has added backround music, that often becomes annoying anddistracting from the visual content.And then there are the Changes in the Words of Jesus that have been made to this new edition of The Jesus Film.In the Original Release of The Jesus Film during the celebration of The Passover, Jesus is talking to His disciples, and one of the things He says, is that if you have no sword to go and sell your cloak and buy one. One of his disciples then picks up two long knives off the ground and says to Jesus that they have two swords, and in this 35th Edition Jesus responds by saying, "Enough of This." But in the Original Release of The Jesus Film, Jesus responds by saying, "That is enough." There you can clearly see how they changed the words of Jesus from the Original Version of The Jesus Film to the 35th Edition. This makes me think that some PeaceNik who would like to see the American People disarmed was responsible for this change. And, if they made this change regarding the words spoken by the actor playing the part of Jesus in this scene, what other changes might they have made in other scenes?Another problem with the 35th Edition is that the narrator in two different places states that Jesus is the Son of God, in a spiritual sense. ( A spiritual sense? )When Jesus was baptized by his cousin John the Baptist in the Jordan River and the heavens opened and God spoke this is My beloved Son in whom I am well pleased, God did NOT say He is My Son in ( a spiritual sense ) He said this is My Son. This sounds to me like there may have been some type of Islamic influence in this particular changing of the words.I did have high hopes for this 35th Anniversary Edition of The Jesus Film, but I must say that I was very disappointed.*  They should have remastered the visual and audio, turned the full screen into widescreen and left the rest alone. Then I would have written a positive review for this new edition. They had a pretty good movie, and they have really messed it up.Therefore, the next time I watch The Jesus Film, I will be watching my older DVD of the Original Version, while this new 35th Anniversary Edition will remain on the shelf to collect dust.Someone once said, "If it ain't broken, don't fix it."I think the people in charge of making this 35th Anniversary Edition should have taken a saying like that to heart.
Title: Jesus Film

reviewText: I am a long time fan of The Jesus Film. And have been following their current efforts to produce a film about Paul. I've had a couple copies of the film, and have given several of them away over the years, and watch it periodically. When I saw the new release being offered in Blu-ray I wondered if it would really be enhanced much, as I've seen some Blu-ray films that don't really look all that good. But I just got mine today and it is fantastic. I don't know how they did it but the Blu-ray is really outstanding High Definition. I haven't had time to compare the Extra Features yet to see if there are new ones, but am very anxious to watch the entire film soon, again."I love to tell the story... of Jesus and His love".
summary: WoW! Spectacular! Blu-ray worth the purchase.
Title: Jesus Film

reviewText: very good movie. First time to see it in blu ray.  At least it has closed caption so my deaf child can see it too.
Title: Jesus Film

reviewText: I'm a fan of this movie, it provides an awesome overview of mankind and the role that Jesus played in our salvation. Highly recommended.
Title: Jesus Film

reviewText: This is a wonderful movie.  I am surprised that  I had never heard about it before.  I have lent it to my daughter (who has a large religious movie collection) and son-in-law.  I had actually bought it for them, but after seeing it myself I think there are other people who 'need' it more.  There are two extra parts that are very interesting, about showing this in other countries in different languages with the result of many people becoming Christians and how/why/where it was made.  I lived in the near east for 15 years and the movie is very culturally realistic and I think those things made it better for me.
Title: Jesus Film

reviewText: Technically very good with loads of different subtitles. My wife loved it but it is for Christian folk and if you are not one of the faithful you may find it heavy going!
summary: Technically good but for the faithful!
Title: Jesus Film

reviewText: This is a classic film on the Life, Death and Resurrection of our LORD JESUS The CHRIST. This movie is based on the Gospel of Luke. which was especially aimed at us gentiles. It shows Jesus' great love for all of humankind and how he has provided a way for all of us to have a personal relationship with Him (God) and receive eternal salvation (through Grace by Faith). This Movie was made as an evangelism tool and has been translate red into many many languages. It is a must have JESUS movie and a Must watch, get it shear it with your family and friends. Buy many as gifts. Great shocking stuffer at Christmas time as well.
Title: Jesus Film

reviewText: This movie is fantastic.  It will wrench your heart and make you think about where you are in your spiritual journey.
Title: Jesus Film
